thesis.description: With the advance of civilization throughout the ages -the progress of science and invention, the growth of cultureand art, the steady rise in standards of living, and the everdiminishing distances separating the various peoples of thisearth - there has been an unceasing change in the philosophiesof life. As the demands and the conditions of life havechanged, so too have our conceptions concerning it#Nowhere has this been more noticeable than in thefiaLd of education; particularly in the past century, duringwhich time, our philosophy of education has undergone many radicalchanges. This is especially true about the philosophyof that branch of education which is commonly known as physicaleducation. In speaking of physical education, we do so inthe broadest sense of the term including the inculcation ofhealth habits; the dissemination of knowledge of bodily functions;the development of organic vigor, muscular strength andneuro-muscular coordination through exercise; the teaching andcoaching of sports and games; and the teaching and directionof recreative activities of a physical nature.[...]
thesis.creator: Orlick, Emanuel.
thesis.subject: Physical education and training -- Psychological aspects.
thesis.title: Psychology for the educator in the field of health, physical education and recreation.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: These studies were carried out in an attempt to elucidate the mode of action of the drug phenothiazine. The first record of phenothiazine (thiodiphenylamine ) appears with its synthesis in 1885 by Bernthsen, in his studies on compounds of the methylene blue group. It gives rise to many dyes, the most important being methylene blue, Lauth’s violet, and thionol. Phenothiazine is a soft, smooth powder of talc-like consistency, slightly off yellowish-white in colour. It has a faint but characteristic odour and taste. It is highly insoluble in water, but readily soluble in the fat solvents, alcohol, xylol, toluol, ether, chloroform. From these it crystallizes out in flat plates. The melting point of pure phenothiazine is 184°C.; the commercial product used as the drug melts at 180-181°C. The molecular weight is 199.4 [...]
thesis.creator: Allen, Della Elizabeth.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: The influence of phenothiazine on cellular metabolism.

thesis.description: L'hérédité et la vie de François de CurelPour comprendre l'oeuvre de François de Curel, il fautd'abord étudier sa vie. En étudiant la vie des grands géniesdu monde on trouve qu'un grand nombre, qui ont atteint les hauteurssont des révoltés, ayant le courage de s'obstiner à une idée quileur semble magnifique. Ajoutez un étrange hasard dans le cas deFrançois de Curel, et vous avez les origines de sa carri~re littéraire.En étudiant ses drames et ses préfaces nous parvenons ~mieux comprendre la perso~alité de l'auteur, car son existence aune étroite connexité avec son oeuvre. Les historiques de sespièces sont importants pour bien marquer l'évolution de la penséede François de Curel.[...]
thesis.creator: Ponticello, Eva Edith.
thesis.subject: French.
CUREL, FRANÇOIS, VICOMTE DE
thesis.title: Les idées dans les préfaces de François de Curel.

thesis.description: 1. A method, for the isolation of vanilloyl and syringoylmethyl ketones as pure crystalline compounds from the bisulfite-soluble fraction of the maple-wood-ethanolysia oils, hasbeen developed.2. The presence of vanillin and syringaldehyde in the bisulfiteaolublefraction of the maple-wood-ethanolysis oils has beenconfir.med by isolation of the two aldehydes as free compounds.3. TWo new compounds, namely, (4-hydroxy-3,5-dimethoxyphenyl)-propanone-2 and (4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)-propanone-2, havebeen isolated from the bisulfite-soluble fraction of the maplewood-ethanolysis oils, and identified by direct syntheses.4. Some properties of the diketones and of the new compoundshave been determined.

thesis.description: During the past half-century, there has been a growing tendency to take Shakespere from the theatre and place him on the bookshelves of educational institutions and private homes. Consequently, Shakespere is thought of more in literary than in theatrical terms, and there has grown up a whole generation of people whose closest association with Shakespere has been in the school or college classroom. In his day, the plays were witnessed, heard, and felt; even in our grandfathersf and fathers' day there were still repertory companies which presented Shakespere as a part of their regular programme. Our ovm generation is one of the few, since the plays were written, to see creditable performances of the plays only at wellspaced intervals, and then usually in large theatrical centres such as London or New York.[...]
thesis.creator: Jackson, Joan Suzanne.
thesis.subject: Theater -- England.
Shakespeare, William, 1564-1616. Hamlet.
Shakespeare, William, 1564-1616 -- Stage history.
thesis.title: An analysis of Elizabethan, and some twentieth century methods of producing Shakespeare’s Hamlet.

thesis.description: The formation of nitrates in soil, under favourable conditions as to moisture, temperature, and aeration is a reaction well known and frequently studied. The bodies yielding nitric acid in the soil are, firstly, the various nitrogenous organic substances which arise from the decay of vegetable or animal matter; and secondly, ammonium salts, either produced in small quantity during the decay of organic matter, or carried to the soil by rain, or in some cases, applied as fertilizers. A further source of the nitrates contained in the soil is to be found in the free nitrogen of the atmosphere, but of any supply of this source, other than the ready-formed nitric acid contained in rain, and the nitrogen fixed by the nitrogen-fixing organisms, there is at present no substantial proof.[...]
thesis.creator: Alarie, Albert Maurice.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Chemistry.
thesis.title: Nitrification and nitrifying organisms in some Quebec soils.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In recent years much educational work has been undertaken to inform the general public of the importance of vitamin C in the daily diet and has increased the demand for foods rich in this vitamin. Eruits and fruit juices are generally good sources of vitamin C, but apples are an exception. Fresh apples contain only about 5-10 mgs. ascorbic acid per 100 gms., the amount depending on the variety, and when processed as apple juice much of this is lost or converted into dehydroascorbic acid. Canned apple juice, therefore, contains from nil to 0.2 mg. reduced ascorbic acid and after two weeks' storage none of the dehydroascorbic acid remains (Strachan 1942). [...]
thesis.creator: Andreae, Wolfgang Albert.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Chemistry.
thesis.title: Vitamin C fortification of apple juice.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

The products isolated were subjected to the customary tests used for the characterization of such substances. 2. Oertain pretreatment& of the starch were shown to yield less satisfactory products than when whole starch was used, while nitration by nitric acid alone was found to give more satisfactory products in higher yield than when a "mixed acid" was used. [...]

thesis.description: Criteria for genetic studies in medicine. Allergy, which was the original subject for the author's thesis, is not a single nosological entity. For that reason it was abandoned after months of study in 1939- 40, in favor of the congenital form of heterotaxy known as situs inversus viscerum (to be defined below), a condit~on which more nearly approaches the characteristics of a Mendelian unit character.[...]

thesis.description: The study of chromosome structure and behaviour antedates by several decades the establishment of genetics on a scientific basis. Beginning, inevitably, as a purely descriptive discipline, chromosome cytology has in recent years expanded and branched until it promises to play an important part in the integration of many fields of scientific investigation. Already it has invaded such subjects as molecular physics and protein chemistry, and made a start, however small, in the interpretation of genetical and embryological observations in chemical terms. With the improvement of present methods of investigation, and the development of new tecnniques, we may look hopefully for great advances along these lines. The present investigation is concerned with the effects of environmental changes on the structure of the chromosomes of several species of Trillium. It is hoped that the result may be an addition, however small, to the knowledge of chromosome behaviour which is prerequisite for the complete understanding of the methods of inheritance.
thesis.creator: Boothroyd, Eric Roger.
thesis.subject: Trilliums.
Chromosomes.
thesis.title: Differential reactivity in the chromosomes of Trillium species.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

Investigation of the hydrol lignin has shown it to be essentially aromatic in character. 3. Hydrogenation studies of hydrol lignin have indicated a marked similarity of behaviour to wood under the same conditions of hydrogenation.[...]

thesis.description: A number of new compounds have been synthesized. They include, among others, eugenol acetate oxide and its chlorhydrin; 1-hydroxyl-( 3,4 dimethoxyphenyl)-propanone-2; 1-(3,4 dimethoxyphenyl)-propanedione-1,2, and probably 3-chlor-1-(4-acetoxy-3 methoxyphenyl)- propanone-2. Several interesting intramolecular rearrangements of aromatic halogenated and hydroxylated ketones of the types, R-CH2-CO-CH2Cl, R-CHOH-CO-CH3 and R-CHBr-CO-CH3 (where R = 3,4 dimethoxyphenyl) have been demonstrated and their bearing on the structure of lignin pointed out.

thesis.title: Studies in lignin progenitors.

thesis.description: Dans cette thèse, je me propose de traiter du sentiment de Dieu et de la nature dans les oeuvres de Francis Jammes. Au premier chapitre, j’essayerai d’expliquer la relation qu’il y a entre les événements de la vie de l’auteur et la publication de ses oeuvres. En prenant chaque ouvrage, en ordre chronologique, je jetterai un coup d’oeil sur chacun en résumant les idées principales. Le chapitre qui suit sera consacré en entier aux oeuvres qui s’intéressent tout particulièrement a la nature et à Dieu. J’étudierai les oeuvres dont les critiques ont traité spécialement. Dans le troisième chapitre, je traiterai l’évolution qui s’est produite dans l’esprit de Francis Jammes quant à Dieu et la nature depuis la première phase de sa carrière littéraire jusqu’à son entier développement et son retour à la foi de son enfance. Son style a été ou bien très critiqué, ou bien très loué. Quelques écrivains ont voulu voir chez lui le rénovateur de la poésie moderne, celui qui savait prendre son inspiration dans la vie rurale, dans la terre, dans la nature: une espèce de Chantecler enfonçant fièrement ses pattes dans le sol, pour y puiser son inspiration. D’autres lui ont reproché de prendre son inspiration d’une vie effacée et commune. Certains auteurs ont admiré son style comme étant l’essence de la simplicité et du lyrisme. D’autres l’ont trouvé naïf, puéril et presque niais. Nous ne nous proposons pas d’étudier ces questions, car le but de cette étude se limite à voir la lente évolution de son esprit quant à sa croyance en Dieu, depuis ses jeunes années jusqu’à sa mort, en passant par la crise de sa conversion.
thesis.creator: Egan, Marie Jogues.
thesis.subject: Jammes, Francis, 1868-1938 -- Criticism and interpretation.
thesis.title: Le sentiment religieux et le sentiment de la nature dans les oeuvres de Francis Jammes.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: When the present war began in September 1939, the evils of inflation so typical of the first world war induced the warring nations to adopt the principle of price control. Germany had established an over-all price ceiling in October 1936, which indicates how long ago Germany had begun to prepare her economy to withstand the shock of war. An actual price inflation constituted no serious threat to Canada at the start of the war because we had idle capital and idle labour. The amount of economic “slack” arising from developments prior to the outbreak of war is surveyed in Chapter I. Briefly, it may be described as the result of the rising period of prosperity which culminated in 1929 and the depression which followed in the 1930’s. Although it appeared in 1937 that we were at last climbing out of the depression, we had another setback in 1938. Thus Canada entered the war with an industrial output far below her capacity. [...]
thesis.creator: Fox, Lester Leonard.
thesis.subject: Prices -- Canada.
Canada -- Economic conditions.
Wages -- Canada.
World War, 1939-1945 -- Economic aspects -- Canada.
thesis.title: Prices and wages in Canada since the beginning of the second World war.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The name “Lorraine” is applied to a group of sandy shale formations of Ordovician age whose type sections are found in northwestern New York on the southwest side of the Adirondack area. The Lorraine beds of New York and equivalent strata of other areas are underlain by black, more or less bituminous shales commonly known as the “Utica” shales. That all so-called “Utica” shales may not be identical in age with the typical Utica formation of Utica, New York, is, however, generally appreciated. Strata which have long been recognized as approximate equivalents of the Utica and Lorraine formations of New York State outcrop in the St. Lawrence Lowland. They are found from Montreal to Quebec over an area whose maximum lateral extent is about ten miles on the northwest side of the St. Lawrence River and thirty miles on the southeast side. The area is widest near Montreal and narrows rapidly near Quebec. [...]
thesis.creator: Harding, Stanley R.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: The geology of the lower Lorraine in the vicinity of Montreal.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The importance of phenanthrene derivatives in pharmacology, physiology and pathology has become clearly recognized since many useful drugs, essential metabolites and potent carcinogens have been shown to include this group in their chemical configuration. Morphine, colchicine, the bile acids, cardiac glucosides, toad poisons, the vitamin D group, cholesterol and the steroid hormones, in spite of their qualitatively different biological activities, are nevertheless closely related chemically in that they are all phenanthrene or perhydrophenanthrene derivatives. [...]
thesis.creator: Hay, Eleanor.
thesis.subject: Steroids -- Metabolism.
thesis.title: Morphological studies of steroid metabolism.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Until very recently interest in the steroid hormones has centered round the problem of their exact chemical structure and their main physiological actions in the organism. Now that the chemical structure and the physiological role of many of these hormones are known interest is being manifested in their intermediary metabolism. An understanding of the changes undergone by the hormones in the course of their inactivation and excretion by the animal body, will, it is hoped, provide information regarding the chemical mechanisms involved when these hormones produce their physiological effects in the organs and tissues upon which they act.
thesis.creator: Hoffman, Martin M.
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: Some aspects of the metabolism of the steroid hormone.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The field of municipal finance has been signally neglected by Canadian economists. With the exception of a few isolated articles and the very indifferent publication known as “The Municipal Review of Canada”, little is written on the subject. The Union of Nova Scotia Municipalities at its Conventions sometimes discusses salient municipal problems, but only too often its proceedings are of little interest to the academic observer. A number of Royal Commissions have sat to consider municipal problems but, apart from obvious generalities, their reports have only too often been of parochial interest only. The main conclusion I can come to is that the prouder problems of federal and provincial finance, and the constitutional and administrative clashes they provoke, have almost completely side-tracked the interest of Canadian economists from the sphere of municipal tribulations. In this they differ materially from their American counterparts, who continually evidence a lively interest in municipal finances and affairs generally, debate them hotly, and write on them freely. [...]
thesis.creator: Jack, Lawrence Bennett.
thesis.subject: Municipal finance -- Canada.
Municipal finance -- Australia.
Municipal finance -- United States.
thesis.title: Control of local government finance in three federal countries : Canada, the United States and Australia : a description and analysis of the major control measures passed and enforced by states and provinces in respect of municipal financi[a]l practices.

thesis.description: A Russian species of dandelion, Taraxacum kok-saghyz Rod. is now being used in that country as a source of rubber. As the rubber produced by this plant is of high quality, it is possible that the propagation of the species in Canada might prove to be of national benefit. Seed of Taraxacum kok-saghyz has been brought to this country, and an effort is being made to determine the potentialities of the plant under Canadian growing conditions. Its proposed introduction here, as a commercial crop, raises problems of breeding and cultivation. The plants show variation in rubber content of the roots, while difficulties of cultivation result from their habits of growth, For this reason an investigation of the cytology of the species has been carried out with the hope that an insight may be obtained into the best methods by which its general characteristics may be improved. [...]
thesis.creator: James, Allen P.
thesis.subject: Kok-saghyz -- Cytology.
Dandelions -- Canada -- Cytology.
thesis.title: An investigation of the cytology of native and Russian species of the genus Taraxacum.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
